alert.note: Alert for Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 8:08AM CDT until June 07 at 3:13PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas... Cottonwood River near Florence affecting Marion County. For the Cottonwood River...including Florence, Cottonwood Falls, Plymouth...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River near Florence. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Outside the levee system in southeast Florence, flood waters flow across Park Ave Road and reach the foundation of a residential home. Northwest of Florence, the bridge on 140th Road and 1/2 mile west of Highway 77 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 25.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Cottonwood River Florence 22.0 19.6 Sun 7 am CDT 25.1 18.9 7.2 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
